Vocabularies.Definition: n. the unlawful use of violence, especially bombing, kidnapping, and assassination, carried out for political purposes 恐怖主义，恐怖行动
think deeply about, remind oneself of (past events) 思考；反思
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We agree that a central purpose of drama has always been to provide a means for a society to reflect upon itself and its beliefs.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  潜意识 a. lacking awareness and the capacity for sensory perception; not conscious 无意识的；未发觉的；不省人事的
transmit (printed matter or an image) by electronic means 传真
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Traveling businesspeople can send and receive electronic mail and fax messages in some airports.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.  extend across in space or time 横跨，横越 n.  跨度，期间
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Travelers will be able to walk across a footbridge that spans the Huangpu River by 2010.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. not disturbed; calm 未受干扰的；安静的，镇定
a. 庄严的，堂皇的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  the stately Temple of Heaven

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  纽约人
v.  run slowly for physical exercise; push slightly 慢跑；轻推 n.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Peter jogged my arm and made me spill my tea.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 脚踏车，自行车
v.  go for a long walk 远足，徒步旅行 n.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We are planning to hike in the country on Sunday.

Vocabularies.Definition: without payment, free; with no reward or result 免费；无酬劳，徒劳
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I know the cyber bar manager, so I always get in for nothing.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  maintaining or being maintained 维护，保养 e.g.  Concrete pavements have a long life and require little maintenance.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  有篷小型（客）货车；先锋
n.  眉毛
v. struggle or compete 斗争，竞争 e.g.  Several teams are contending for the prize.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  不赞成的，反对的 e.g.  When I showed my newly-bought suit to her, she cast a disapproving look at it.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: put (sb./sth.) forward as an example, show 将…视为范例 e.g.  This school is being held up as a model for other middle schools in the city.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  to the point; related 中肯的；有关的，相干的 e.g.  If you intend to be a teacher, you have to obtain knowledge and skills pertinent to classroom teaching.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 重击，冲击力 vt. 猛击，击溃
n. 新娘
n.  痛苦，不幸 e.g.  Euthanasia is a practice of mercifully ending a person's life in order to release the person from an incurable disease and intolerable suffering.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  种族混合的，不同种族间的
n.  未婚妻
accept (sth. that is seen as not quite satisfactory) 勉强接受，勉强认可
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I would like a job in banking, but jobs are so scarce at the moment I would settle for anything.

Vocabularies.Definition: be produced or published; become known, be revealed 发表，出版；公开，透露
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The dictionary has just come out on CD-ROM.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  old-fashioned, tiresomely simple and sentimental 过时的，陈腐的，伤感的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Believe me she's going to tell you the corny joke again.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 身份证 vt. 给…发身份证
n. 标签，附加物 vt. 加标签于，紧随
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Staff were required to wear name tags at work.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. thin cord; a series of things put together on a thread 细绳，线；一串，一行 vt.（用绳、线）悬挂，系住
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The parcel was tied up with string.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 铝
v. think about carefully and for a long time 沉思，考虑
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I found myself constantly pondering the question: "What's the meaning of life?"

Vocabularies.Definition: suddenly 突然
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  All the kids were quietly asleep, when, all of a sudden, the bell rang.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  吊裤带
n. 付薪水的支票；薪水
a. not easily seen or understood; not well-known 不易看清的；费解的，朦胧的；不出名的 vt. 使暗，使模糊
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The letter is written in rather obscure language.

Vocabularies.Definition: n., v. 繁荣，迅速发展
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  As workers born during the baby boom of 1946-1964 have aged, the work force in the United States has grown progressively older.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  the state of being unable to live for ever; the rate of deaths among a certain kind of people 必死性；死亡率
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The nation's infant mortality rate has reached a record low.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad. (infml) = no
a. 道听途说的，趣闻轶事的
a.  统计的，统计学的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The teacher made a statistical analysis of how frequently certain words are used in speech and writing.

Vocabularies.Definition: support; make a copy of (a disk, a file, etc.) 支持，复制…作为备份
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Only a few employees backed him up in the election.

Vocabularies.Definition: n., a. 婴儿（的），幼儿（的）
n. 兜；（自行车等）行李架；搬运工具；运送者；航空母舰
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Your carrier for this flight is British Airways.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  折叠式婴儿手推车；散步者，闲逛者
n.  （电影或电视的）片段，镜头
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The film contained some old newsreel footage.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  enclose with a covering 包住，覆盖，包围
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Walking in the forest, we felt the rich fragrant smell of the forest enveloping us.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. 恶魔（般）的
n. 治疗专家
n. a young person between childhood and adulthood 青少年 a. 青春期的，青春
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Historically, the task of instructing adolescents about sex has been seen as the responsibility of the parents.

Vocabularies.Definition: send (sth.) to a place where it will be dealt with 寄送，呈交
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Applicants were asked to send in a CV and a covering letter.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi. happen again or repeatedly 复发，反复出现
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Although he was not caught cheating on the exam, the feelings of guilt recurred over and over again.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. not usual, exceptional 不寻常的，与众不同的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  A profusion of Japanese cherry trees is an unusual feature of the garden.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. (wove, woven) 编，织，编排 n. 编法，织法，编织式样
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  In The Emperor's New Clothes, the two strangers declare they can weave the finest stuff anyone can imagine.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. the ability to imagine; sth. only imagined and not real 想象（力）；想象出来的东西
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Einstein's genius was characterized equally by logical clarity and creative imagination.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  free from control 无拘无束的，自由自在的
